definition: building (a relatively large, multi-storey one)/CL:幢[zhuang4],座[zuo4]
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
house with more than 1 story/storied building/floor/CL:層|层[ceng2],座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]
World Trade Center (the twin towers destroyed by the 9-11 terrorists)
pinyin: Shi4 mao4 Zhong1 xin1 Da4 lou2

sentences.english: They climb walls, leap off buildings and spy on enemies.
sentences.chinese: 它们会爬墙，能跳下大楼，还能暗中监视敌人。

sentences.english: A banal landscape of ugly new towers flanks both sides.
sentences.chinese: 马路两遍的是平凡丑陋的新摩天大楼的景象。

sentences.english: China's love for towering skyscrapers just got turned upside down.
sentences.chinese: 中国对摩天大楼的热爱一百八十度大转弯。

sentences.english: Skyscrapers are also lavish consumers, and wasters, of electirc power.
sentences.chinese: 摩天大楼还是电能的过度消费者与浪费者。

sentences.english: Why is it called a "building" when it is already built?
sentences.chinese: 为什么一栋已经竣工的大楼还用进行式？

sentences.english: Unlike a skyscraper, your garden will grow weeds.
sentences.chinese: 和摩天大楼不同，你的花园会长出野草。

sentences.english: Can you please show me where is Domestic Terminal?
sentences.chinese: 你能告诉我国内候机大楼在哪里吗？

sentences.english: The widow owns this building and its surrounding lands.
sentences.chinese: 这位孀妇拥有这幢大楼及其周围的地产。

sentences.english: The curriculum includes a lesson from the firemen on how to rappel from a building.
sentences.chinese: 其中的课程包括消防员教授如何用绳索从大楼上下来。

sentences.english: It cost two billion dollars to build this building.
sentences.chinese: 盖这大楼花了二十亿元。

sentences.english: The inauguration ceremony for the new Hengqin Port Joint Inspection Complex Building was ceremoniously held on the morning of December 8th.
sentences.chinese: 横琴口岸新联检大楼落成典礼8日上午隆重举行。

sentences.english: Museums and the Smithsonian Institution buildings are on the north and south sides of the Mall.
sentences.chinese: 博物馆和史密森氏学会大楼在广场的北面和南面。

sentences.english: A modern office building is standing on the site of the old bookstore.
sentences.chinese: 一座现代化办公大楼矗立在这家书店的故址上。

sentences.english: There is a beggar in frond of the building in the school.
sentences.chinese: 学校的大楼前面有一个要饭的。

sentences.english: Another office building was opened in 2001 as BOC Centre.
sentences.chinese: 另一新办公大楼奥海中心于2001年改为中银中心。

definition: (used in the names of grand buildings such as 百老匯大廈|百老汇大厦 Broadway Mansions (in Shanghai) or 帝國大廈|帝国大厦 Empire State Building etc)
house with more than 1 story/storied building/floor/CL:層|层[ceng2],座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]
top floor/attic/loft/garret/penthouse/(flat) rooftop (often used as an outdoor living area etc)
a building of two or more stories/CL:棟|栋[dong4],幢[zhuang4],座[zuo4]
